text: Rox Park, also known as Municipal Stadium, was a baseball park located in St. Cloud, Minnesota. It opened in 1948 and served as the home stadium for the minor league St. Cloud Rox through the 1970 season. The stadium was demolished in 1971 and was replaced by a ShopKo department store, a Byerly's grocery store and a small enclosed two story mall.DigitalBallparks.com Home plate was retained and located in the entryway of the ShopKo store until the early 1990s. Its seating capacity fluctuated from 5,000 in 1947 to 3,600 in 1949.BR Minors ==References== Category:Sports venues in Minnesota Category:Sports venues completed in 1948 Category:Sports venues demolished in 1971 Category:1971 disestablishments in Minnesota Category:Demolished sports venues in Minnesota Category:1948 establishments in Minnesota
title: Rox Park
